ArrayPredicate.description: Predicate for array values; will match based on configured options.
ArrayPredicate.title: array

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

updateOnWrite.description: Don't expect a response from the protocol just update the attribute immediately on write

valueFilters.description: Defines ValueFilters to apply to an incoming value before it is written to a protocol linked attribute; this is particularly useful for generic protocols. The message should pass through the filters in array order

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

BooleanPredicate.description: Predicate for boolean values; will evaluate the value as a boolean and match against this predicates value, any value that is not a boolean will not match
BooleanPredicate.title: boolean

CalendarEventPredicate.description: Predicate for calendar event values; will match based on whether the calendar event is active for the specified time.
CalendarEventPredicate.title: Calendar

DateTimePredicate.description: Predicate for date time values; provided values should be valid ISO 8601 datetime strings (e.g. yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssÂ±HH:mm), offset and time are optional, if no offset information is supplied then UTC is assumed.
DateTimePredicate.title: datetime

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

updateOnWrite.description: Don't expect a response from the protocol just update the attribute immediately on write

valueFilters.description: Defines ValueFilters to apply to an incoming value before it is written to a protocol linked attribute; this is particularly useful for generic protocols. The message should pass through the filters in array order

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

contentType.description: The content type header value to use when making requests for this linked attribute (shortcut alternative to using headers parameter)

headers.description: A JSON object of headers to be added to HTTP request; the key represents the name of the header and for each string value supplied a new header will be added with the key name and specified string value

messageConvertBinary.description: Indicates that the HTTP response is binary and should be converted to binary string representation

messageConvertHex.description: Indicates that the HTTP response is binary and should be converted to hexadecimal string representation

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

method.description: The HTTP method to use when making requests for this linked attribute

pagingMode.description: Indicates that the HTTP server supports pagination using the standard Link header mechanism

path.description: The URL path to append to the agents Base URL when making requests for this linked attribute

pollingAttribute.description: Allows the polled response to be written to another attribute with the specified name on the same asset as the linked attribute

pollingMillis.description: Indicates that this HTTP request is used to update the linked attribute; this value indicates how frequently the HTTP request is made in order to update the linked attribute value

queryParameters.description: A JSON object of query parameters to be added to HTTP request URL; the key represents the name of the query parameter and for each string value supplied a new query parameter will be added with the key name and specified string value (e.g. 'https://..../?test=1&test=2')

updateOnWrite.description: Don't expect a response from the protocol just update the attribute immediately on write

valueFilters.description: Defines ValueFilters to apply to an incoming value before it is written to a protocol linked attribute; this is particularly useful for generic protocols. The message should pass through the filters in array order

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

fromMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming mail message from address(es) to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

subjectMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming mail message subjects to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

updateOnWrite.description: Don't expect a response from the protocol just update the attribute immediately on write

useSubject.description: Use the subject as value instead of the body

valueFilters.description: Defines ValueFilters to apply to an incoming value before it is written to a protocol linked attribute; this is particularly useful for generic protocols. The message should pass through the filters in array order

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

readAddress.description: Zero based address from which the value is read from

readMemoryArea.description: Memory area to read from during read request

readRegistersAmount.description: Set amount of registers to read. If left empty or less than 1, will use the default size for the corresponding data-type.

readValueType.description: Type to convert the returned data to. As specified by the PLC4X Modbus data types.

updateOnWrite.description: Don't expect a response from the protocol just update the attribute immediately on write

valueFilters.description: Defines ValueFilters to apply to an incoming value before it is written to a protocol linked attribute; this is particularly useful for generic protocols. The message should pass through the filters in array order

writeAddress.description: Zero-based address to which the value sent is written to

writeMemoryArea.description: Memory area to write to. "HOLDING" or "COIL" allowed.

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

publishTopic.description: An MQTT topic to publish attribute events to, any received payload will be pushed into the attribute; use write value converter and/or write value to do any processing, complex processing may require a rule or a custom MQTT agent

qos.description: QoS level to use for publish/subscribe (default is 0 if unset)

subscriptionTopic.description: An MQTT topic to subscribe to, any received payload will be pushed into the attribute; use value filter(s) to extract values from string payloads and/or value converters to do simple value mapping, complex processing may require a rule or a custom MQTT agent

updateOnWrite.description: Don't expect a response from the protocol just update the attribute immediately on write

valueFilters.description: Defines ValueFilters to apply to an incoming value before it is written to a protocol linked attribute; this is particularly useful for generic protocols. The message should pass through the filters in array order

writeValue.description: String to be used for attribute writes and can contain dynamic placeholders to allow dyanmic value and/or time injection with formatting (see documentation for details) into the string or alternatively write the string through to the protocol as is (static string)

NumberPredicate.description: Predicate for number values; will match based on configured options.
NumberPredicate.title: number

RadialGeofencePredicate.description: Predicate for GEO JSON point values; will return true if the point is within the specified radius of the specified latitude and longitude unless negated.
RadialGeofencePredicate.title: Radial geofence

RectangularGeofencePredicate.description: Predicate for GEO JSON point values; will return true if the point is within the specified rectangle specified as latitude and longitude values of two corners unless negated.
RectangularGeofencePredicate.title: Rectangular geofence

messageMatchFilters.description: ValueFilters to apply to incoming messages prior to comparison with the messageMatchPredicate

messageMatchPredicate.description: The predicate to apply to incoming messages to determine if the message is intended for the linked attribute; the value used in the predicate can be filtered using the message match filters. This must be defined to enable attributes to be updated by the linked agent.

replayData.description: Used to store 24h dataset of values that should be replayed (i.e. written to the linked attribute) in a continuous loop.
